text:
“Thief! Out of my lodging. Police, police!” Amalia Ivanovna yelled. 

Raskolnikov kept his eyes on Sonia. She stood still, pale and quiet. Suddenly, color rushed to her cheeks. 

“No, it wasn’t I! I didn’t take it!” she cried, hiding her face in her hands. 

Katerina Ivanovna clasped her tightly. “Sonia! I don’t believe it!” 

She swayed Sonia, kissing her face and hands. “You took it? How stupid! You don’t know her heart! She’d sell her last rag to help you!” 

Katerina turned to the room. “Defend her! Why are you all standing still?” 

“Rodion Romanovitch, why don’t you stand up for her?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia is unjustly accused of theft, prompting Katerina Ivanovna to passionately defend her character and plead for compassion from those around them.
